explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Since the flash point was -29 degC (Closed Cup) and the initial boiling point was 55 - 58 degC (boiling point in this case) (ICSC, 1998), it was classified as Category 2.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: UNRTDG is classified into 6.1 (3) and I according to the U.N. number (2334) peculiar to a substance. It carried out outside Category.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although ICSC (J) (1998) have description "caustic is indicated to aluminum, tin and zinc," test data is not found and it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Between rat LD50 values of 102mg/kg and 106mg/kg (all are PATTY (5th, 2001)), the higher toxic value (102mg/kg) was adopted, and it was classified as category 3.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 1 based on rabbit LD50 value = 35mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: The vapor pressures at 25degC is 242mmHg (after conversion: 323hPa), and 177ppm was thought to be in vapor state. Since rat inhalation LC50 value of 177ppm/8h (RTECS (2004)) is converted to LC50 = 0.583mg/L/4h, it was classified as Category 2.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is a notation that there is caustic to humans (SITTIG (4th, 2002)). But also there are "redness" (ICSC (J) (1998)), "irritation to the skin" (HSDB, 2003) (NFPA), and taking into consideration that the result of STANDARD DRAIZE TEST (Severe, RTECS (2004)) to a rabbit is a longer processing time (24hr) than usual, although it did not reach caustic, it was thought that there was strong irritation and it was set as Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the description of stimulating the human eye (ICSC (J) (1998), SITTIG (4th, 2002), HSDB (2003), or accident exapmles (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it has eye irritation. But it is insufficient of the data which judges subdivision, therefore, it was classified into Category 2A-2B. [Indication] 2A is recommended based on the safety, when the Category needs to subdivide.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (inhalation:lung); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 2 (inhalation: lungs) based on the report, "inhalation of the fumes may cause pulmonary edema" in humans (SITTIG (4th, 2002), ICSC (J) (1998)), and as Category 3 (airway irritant) based on the report, "causes irritation to eyes and airways" (ICSC (J) (1998)), and on an accident case (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (heart) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since we found the description that "the myocardial may be affected and tissue damage may be occured" to human (ICSC (J) (1998)), we classified it into Category 2 (heart).

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Since there is a description of the possibility of pulmonary edema by aspiration in human (SITTIG (4th, 2002)),however, we have no more information satisfing terms of the guidelines of the classification basis, we could not classify because of insufficient data.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96-hour LC50=6000microg/L of fishes (Goldfish) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 , and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 41% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=0.03(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
